question.title: Encountering java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: Unknown column 'RESERVED' in 'where clause' when building on Linux
question.body:
Just switched to the Linux Manjaro from Windows 11. I encountered such problem: I receive this exception: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: "Unknown column 'RESERVED' in 'where clause'". I get it when I build (mvn clean package) or run my super simple Spring Boot app with only one controller (I created it for test, but I also receive that exception on my other projects). I'm using mariadb from 11.2.3-MariaDB, client 15.2 for Linux and Liquibase 4.24 for db version controlling.

Here is .yml script to create a table:

databaseChangeLog:
  - changeSet:
      id: create-cars-table
      author: Yaroslav
      changes:
        - createTable:
            tableName: cars
            columns:
              - column:
                  name: id
                  type: bigint
                  autoIncrement: true
                  constraints:
                    primaryKey: true
                    nullable: false
              - column:
                  name: manufacturer
                  type: varchar(255)
                  constraints:
                    nullable: false
              - column:
                  name: model
                  type: varchar(255)
                  constraints:
                    nullable: false
              - column:
                  name: year
                  type: INTEGER
                  constraints:
                    nullable: false
              - column:
                  name: deleted
                  type: boolean
                  defaultValueBoolean: false
                  constraints:
                    nullable: false

Here is code of model:

package application.car.model;

import jakarta.persistence.Column;
import jakarta.persistence.Entity;
import jakarta.persistence.GeneratedValue;
import jakarta.persistence.GenerationType;
import jakarta.persistence.Id;
import jakarta.persistence.Table;
import lombok.EqualsAndHashCode;
import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.Setter;
import org.hibernate.annotations.SoftDelete;

@Getter
@Setter
@EqualsAndHashCode(of = "id")
@SoftDelete
@Entity
@Table(name = "cars")
public class Car {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long id;
    @Column(nullable = false)
    private String manufacturer;
    @Column(nullable = false)
    private String model;
    @Column(nullable = false)
    private Integer year;
}

As you can see I don't create any fields/columns with name 'RESERVED'. In addition, this exception don't affect programs' work. And it also says "BUILD SUCCESS" but still I do want to fix that problem.

I have tried reinstalling database, tried to read Spring and Hibernate logs but that did not really work for me(

Here is full stack trace of the exception:
